image.altText: A woman holds a tray of meat in a supermarket.

props.synopsis: Inflation comes in lower than expected, with prices rising just 0.6 per cent over the December quarter and 4.1 per cent over the past year.

title.children: Inflation fall 'should kill off' any lingering rate rise risks

image.altText: Aerial footage of floodwaters at Jandowae

props.synopsis: Damage assessments will be carried out today in parts of southern and south-east Queensland, after days of torrential rain with a severe weather warning in place for heavy rain in the state's western interior.

title.children: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily expected to do a U-turn, with 'days of rainfall' to continue for Queensland

image.altText: A young Indigenous woman sits with two small children whose faces are blurred

props.synopsis: The Kowanyama woman was 23 when she was last seen with a quarry caretaker more than 10 years ago, leading to a long-running inquest and a $500,000 reward.

title.children: Police charge man with murder of Cape York woman missing for a decade

image.altText: Figurines of travellers walking with bags, in front of a large Booking.com logo in a photographer's illustration.

props.synopsis: Australia's consumer rights watchdog sees a sharp increase in Australians citing the popular accommodation site when reporting they've been scammed.

title.children: Travellers and accommodation providers falling victim to major Booking.com scam

image.altText: Federal education minister Jason Clare speaking at a press confernce in Perth

props.synopsis: The agreement is the first of eight that need to be negotiated with state and territory governments this year.

title.children: Minister eyes deal to fully fund public schools across country after landmark WA agreement

image.altText: A baby in a pink jumpsuit lies on a bicycle

props.synopsis: Hamas said the proposed deal would see the group first release men, children, the elderly and wounded while humanitarian delivery would resume in Gaza.

title.children: Hamas studies ceasefire deal, hope for hostages and humanitarian aid to resume

image.altText: Fuzzy sonar vision of what looks like the shape of a plane from a bird's eyeview.

props.synopsis: After countless searches for Amelia Earhart's plane, Deep Sea Vision's sonar images may be the latest clue for solving the decades-old mystery.

title.children: Deep sea explorers believe they've captured a sonar image that could unravel one of aviation's greatest mysteries

image.altText: A murky river flowing beneath a bridge in the city of Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The deaths follow heavy rain that caused flash flooding in Queensland's south-east. Authorities are investigating the cause of the deaths, which have left locals distressed.

title.children: Dead fish and mud crabs wash up along Brisbane River after potential contamination event

image.altText: A snake on a fence.

props.synopsis: Michelle McKenzie realised she was not alone in the waist-deep water that was rising through her Laidley chook pen, counting 16 snakes trying to escape the water around her home.

title.children: Mum wades into snake nightmare as she and son try to save chickens from floodwater

image.altText: Cody family

props.synopsis: Like many young Australians 26-year-old Cody is struggling with the housing crisis and with dwindling vacancy rates in Perth she, her partner and her friends have landed at her grandmother's place as a last resort as their search continues.

title.children: Rental crisis is hitting young people hard as they seek alternate accommodation

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu wearing suit stands in front of flag of Israel

props.synopsis: The biblical story of Amalek was invoked by Israel's Benjamin Netanyahu following the October 7 Hamas attack. South Africa says this is evidence of genocidal intent. But who were the Amalekites, and why is this relevant to the ICJ case?

title.children: Why a biblical story is central to South Africa's ICJ case against Israel

image.altText: Canberra doctor Nathem Al-Naser

props.synopsis: Canberra doctor Nathem Al-Naser is banned from providing health services after authorities find he was sexually inappropriate towards two female patients.

title.children: 'Your boyfriend is lucky': Canberra doctor's registration torn up after non-consensual breast exam, sexual inappropriateness

image.altText: A man holds a bunch of bridles.

props.synopsis: A 10-month investigation into Tasmania's harness racing industry has found individuals within the industry engaged in team driving, race fixing and animal abuse.

title.children: Findings of race fixing, team driving made after ABC report into Tasmanian harness racing industry

image.altText: Two women with heads close together with woman on right holding a newborn baby

props.synopsis: Some women who desperately want to breastfeed their babies are giving up because of a lack of support in regional and rural Australia.

title.children: Greta was determined to breastfeed, but when she took her baby back to her remote home, everything fell apart

image.altText: three aboriginal people inside a flood shelter surrounded by blankets

props.synopsis: For more than 20 years, residents and local authorities have been calling for Pigeon Hole to be relocated to a nearby cattle station. The NT government now claims it's listening.

title.children: Flooded twice in 12 months, an outback town's plea to move to higher ground gathers momentum

image.altText: Green leader Adam Bandt speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The lowest 40 per cent of income earners will receive less than 10 per cent of the benefits afforded under the reshaped stage three tax cuts, according to analysis from the independent Parliamentary Budget Office.

title.children: Reshaped tax cuts still overwhelmingly benefit highest earners, PBO analysis shows

image.altText: A group of stockmen stand in a line with one mounted on a horse.

props.synopsis: The historic site of the Wave Hill walk-off — a seminal turning point in Australian history — has allegedly been damaged.

title.children: NT government to launch legal action over alleged damage to National Heritage Listed Wave Hill walk-off site

image.altText: A pilot in a cockpit adjusting buttons.

props.synopsis: Each year, a team of scientists flies directly into the eyes of some of the world’s biggest storms as they try to solve one of meteorology's greatest forecasting fears — the rapid intensification of life-threatening hurricanes and cyclones.

title.children: Fly into the eye of a hurricane with scientists on meteorology's most challenging mission

image.altText: Madeleine speaks in parliament in a bright red blazer, black glasses and gestures with her left hand.

props.synopsis: Resources Minister Madeleine King has used a week-long visit to Japan and South Korea to assure both government and business figures that Australia will remain a "reliable supplier" of export gas well into the future.

title.children: How long will Australia remain a major gas exporter? It depends who you ask

image.altText: The feet of someone pretending to be going to the toilet in the bush, with a poo pot.

props.synopsis: Wilderness rangers encourage bushwalkers to use poo pots after noticing an "unprecedented" amount of human faeces in remote places.

title.children: When you go bushwalking what should you do with your poo? Hint: It's not dig a hole

image.altText: A diver holds up a bag containing a red handfish underwater.

props.synopsis: There are fewer than 100 red handfish left in the wild. As a severe marine heatwave threatens their last remaining habitat, researchers say they had to take drastic action.

title.children: Divers capture red handfish as severe marine heatwave poses extinction threat

image.altText: An older blond woman lies on the chest of a young, brunette man

props.synopsis: Julianne Moore and Charles Melton star in May December as a married couple who began their affair when she was 36 and he was just 13 years old.

title.children: In May December an adult woman has an affair with a 13-year-old. That's just the start of the story

image.altText: Shoppers on escalators in Myer in Perth's CBD.

props.synopsis: Australia's annual inflation rate has hit a two-year low, while a US court rules that Elon Musk's record-breaking $84 billion pay package could be voided. Follow live.

title.children: Inflation falls to two-year low of 4.1pc, judge strikes down Musk's $84b Tesla pay packet

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian share market sets new record high after cooler inflation data
📺 What do the inflation numbers tell us about the state of the economy?
IGO freezes nickel project, trims lithium forecast

image.altText: David Anderson reacting to questions at Senate Estimates. He is a balding white man with blue eyes, wearing a blue suit.

props.synopsis: The ABC's managing director David Anderson says he does not believe trust in the national broadcaster has been damaged by allegations it submitted to pressure from pro-Israeli lobbying to sack journalist Antoinette Lattouf.

title.children: ABC managing director says people 'still trust' the broadcaster, after Lattouf sacking

image.altText: A close up of Indian Myna, background blurred.

props.synopsis: When Indian mynas move into an area they force native birds out of their wood hollows and kill their chicks, leading to a decline in native bird numbers.

title.children: Bird ranked one of the world's 100 most invasive species spreading its territory in Australia

image.altText: A checkout stacked with groceries including tomato sauce and shampoo

props.synopsis: A mother-of-four in the Northern Territory says it makes more sense for her to drive 150 kilometres to a larger town than shop for groceries locally.

title.children: Why some of the poorest Australians are paying higher prices for their groceries

image.altText: Thick, black smoke billows over the rooves of houses near a factory fire in West Footscray.

props.synopsis: After a pollution disaster passes, communities are left with mental trauma. Now, Victoria's environmental watchdog is developing a tool to help it measure that impact to offer support and bolster prosecutions.

title.children: After smoke choked this Melbourne suburb, residents simmered with anxiety. A new tool is trying to measure it

image.altText: An aerial photo of a livestock carrier ship

props.synopsis: Some of the animals on board the controversy-plagued live export ship MV Bahijah will be offloaded in Western Australia and the rest sent back to the Middle East, under a plan put forward by the export company.

title.children: Plan emerges to remove some livestock from ship stranded off Perth and export remainder back to Middle East

image.altText: A man collecting spider webs.

props.synopsis: While spider webs could not trap an elephant, their ability to trap minuscule fragments of DNA could change how scientists learn about wildlife, according to new Australian research.

title.children: These Australian researchers think spider webs could be our 'secret weapon' to understanding nature

image.altText: A woman in a button-up shirt and hat holds a halter rope, a beige-coloured horse beside her

props.synopsis: Relocating to Kilkivan just before COVID lockdowns meant Andrea Ferris didn't make initial connections in town. Four years on, her "innovative approach" is bringing the community together.

title.children: Loneliness affects one in three people. After feeling 'stuck' at home Andrea decided to make a change

image.altText: Roberto Mancini points

props.synopsis: The Socceroos will meet South Korea in the Asian Cup quarterfinals after Jurgen Klinsmann's charges beat Saudi Arabia on penalties in the round of 16.

title.children: Saudi coach walks away during shootout as South Korea sets up Socceroos clash

image.altText: Person holding shopping bags, legs only

props.synopsis: While it's clear many thrifty shoppers saw the need to hunt for Christmas gift bargains in November, the Australian Bureau of Statistics notes that overall spending has been subdued.

title.children: A pull-back in Australians' spending habits is concerning economists

image.altText: A young girl lays on hospital bed with green body cast with stars, she holds a white teddy bear with a matching green cast.

props.synopsis: Monique was the first patient in SA to receive a full-body cast for treatment of scoliosis. After three years, she can finally take it off, but there are still challenges ahead.

title.children: For three years, Monique hasn't been able to scratch, swim or shower — until now
